speaker: Niles
text: Have you noticed there are fewer hazlenuts in these biscotti?

speaker: Frasier
text: So I'm not crazy.

speaker: Niles
text: And yet they've gone up twenty-five cents.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, fewer nuts, more money - something I've been aspiring to for my entire professional life! [_they laugh_] _Roz enters through the front door in a rather shabby tracksuit, the front of which is drenched in sweat.  Added to this, her hair is clumsily tied up behind her head with sweat beads trickling down her forehead.  She is wearing shorts and is out of breath._

speaker: Roz
text: [_catching breath:_] That's the last time I jog in these shorts. My thighs are chafing like a couple of hams wrapped in velcro! [_shouting to waitress:_] Non-fat Mocha, please!

speaker: Roz
text: What?!

speaker: Frasier
text: As flattered as we are that you've chosen our company over, say... a shower, perhaps you'd like to go to the ladies room to freshen up a little bit?

speaker: Roz
text: [_angry:_] Hey, at least I try to keep in shape.  I haven't seen one of you two run an eight minute mile!

speaker: Niles
text: Stand upwind of us and you might!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, by the way Niles, my benefit for the Seattle Theatre Ensemble is tonight - I haven't recieved your check yet.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that's because I'm still not sure if I'm coming. Whom should I expect to meet there?

speaker: Frasier
text: Professional people... around our age..

speaker: Niles
text: [_wanting more:_] Hmmm.

speaker: Frasier
text: Same social standing...

speaker: Niles
text: [_strangely:_] Yoww!

speaker: Frasier
text: Specific-minded... interested in the arts...

speaker: Niles
text: [_angry:_] Oh for God's sake, how many women?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, why didn't you say so?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I thought my rutting monkey body language would have tipped you off.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, pertaining to my RSVP list there should be quite a few available women.

speaker: Niles
text: In that case I'll be there. [_writes check and hands it to Frasier:_] Here's my money - it better be worth my while!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sharp_] Oh look, here comes Sherry and Dad.

speaker: Niles
text: [_sharp_] Duck!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, no, I invited them.

speaker: Niles
text: Sherry's not going to be there at your benefit tonight, is she?  I can stop that check!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, just relax.  I came up with a rather ingenious plan to occupy their evening - I bought tickets to an event which is right up their aisle.  I felt so mortified just buying the tickets, I paid cash so they couldn't trace it back to me. _Martin and Sherry enter Caf e Nervosa as the waitress holds up some tickets, shouting. _

speaker: Waitress
text: Excuse me, people!  Did somebody leave some tickets back here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, good Lord! [_shouting and running:_] Yes!

speaker: Waitress
text: Something called, "Nashville on Ice!"

speaker: Frasier
text: Right here. [_trying to get them off_] _By this time, Frasier is tugging at the tickets as a group stand laughing at him._

speaker: Waitress
text: [_reading:_] "Ice skating country jamboree."

speaker: Frasier
text: [_takes tickets; off the crowd's grins:_] Oh, don't look so smug - try skating and blowing into a jug while your heart's breaking!

speaker: Sherry
text: I can't believe you scored tickets to that.  You are well- connected in this town.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually these are gifts for you and dad.

speaker: Martin/Sherry
text: [_excited:_] Oh, that's great.

speaker: Frasier
text: I hope you're free.

speaker: Martin
text: [_takes tickets:_] Well, we are now!  Wow, Frasier, thanks. Look at this, rink side. _Niles has now put on his jacket and is ready to leave the Caf e -- but now before Sherry has made her mark on him._

speaker: Sherry
text: [_to Niles:_] Oh, what's that on your cheek?  _Niles searches as Sherry plants a big kiss on his cheek leaving an imprint of lipstick.  Niles gives a polite laugh._

speaker: Sherry
text: My lips!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, look at the time, I have to go.

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, it seems that everytime I see you, you're just leaving.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, and I'd love to stay but I... [_excusing:_] have my therapy group meeting... and last time I was late the, er, compulsive gamblers were betting the passive/aggressors that they couldn't make the overeaters... cry.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you two take a seat here, I'll get us a couple of coffees!

speaker: Sherry
text: You know how I like it - hot and sweet.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, but how do you like your coffee?

speaker: Sherry
text: [_laughs before sitting with Frasier:_] Is he always that funny?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes. [_polite laugh_] _Roz enters from the powder room.  There is less sweat though it is still clearly visible.  This time a blotch of soap has been squelched right on top of it.  Frasier gives a condoling sound._

speaker: Roz
text: That damn soap dispenser - I just gave it a good tap and splat! [_points to mark on shirt_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm sorry.  Roz Doyle, my producer, you haven't met my dad's inamorata, Sherry Dempsey.

speaker: Roz
text: I normally look a lot better than this!

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh now, you don't have to be self-conscious around me, hon. We all have our bad days once we pass forty! [_laughs_] Nice seeing you. [_goes to counter where Martin is_]

speaker: Roz
text: [_confused:_] What did she say?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, who cares?!  The least I can do to lengthen out a few precious moments of silence without her underfoot. The woman's practically moved in with me.

speaker: Roz
text: What did she say? [_sits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Be calm now, come on.  You may not look your best today but there's a man sitting right over there - he can't keep his eyes off of you.

speaker: Roz
text: [_modest:_] Oh, where?

speaker: Frasier
text: Right over there. [_points_]  _Roz looks around.  There is a man sitting on the bench seat next to the window.  He is squinting at Roz.  Roz turns back worried._

speaker: Roz
text: [_worried:_] Oh my _God_ , that's John Coughlin from my high school! [_praying:_] Oh dear God, please don't let him recognize me.  I swear I'll never leave the house unbeautiful again!

speaker: John
text: [_coming over:_] Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: [_to God:_] Thanks for listening!

speaker: John
text: Roz Doyle?  It's me, John Coughlin. _Roz takes her coffee away from her mouth.  A fine milk moustache is left in its place._

speaker: Roz
text: [_nice:_] Hi John, look at you.

speaker: John
text: Look at you!

speaker: Roz
text: I hardly recognised you with that moustache!  Oh Frasier, I'm sorry.  This is John Coughlin, Frasier Crane.  So did you just move to Seattle?

speaker: John
text: No, I'm out here for a week on business - now it's back to Wisconsin.  Remember Marcy?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.

speaker: John
text: She's getting married on Saturday.

speaker: Roz
text: No kidding!

speaker: John
text: Well, I'm late for a meeting but it was great running into you, I can't wait to tell the whole gang I saw you.

speaker: Roz
text: You don't have to do that!

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, that guy was the biggest gossip in my home town. He saw me with my hair all sweaty, my sweatshirt full of soap!  Oh God, what could be worse?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, here's a hint: Got Milk?

speaker: Roz
text: [_finds moustache:_] Oh, no! **HAT TRICK**  _Scene Two - Frasier's apartment. That night Frasier is at his benefit with Niles aside him. Upper classes are swarming around them._

speaker: Frasier
text: At first, I was terribly nervous about hosting these things, but it seems to be going rather well.

speaker: Niles
text: Not for me.  I haven't made in-roads with a single woman here. _Niles gets excited upon noticing a woman.  He gives a strange look with his eyebrow which looks like an inspector after finding a hidden clue._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_confused:_] What are you doing?  You look nauseated!

speaker: Niles
text: That woman is flirting with me, this is my "I'm available" face.

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop it!  My God, people'll think the shrimp is bad. Alright, which one?

speaker: Niles
text: Er... at nine � clock: blonde hair, blue dress. [_the woman heads toward them_] Oh, now ten � clock... 11 � clock... oh Mama, high noon. _The woman - Adair Peck - has now arrived where Frasier and Niles are standing._

speaker: Adair
text: I'm sorry, I have to leave early.  I just wanted to let you know what a lovely time I had.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, thank you, it's good to see you.  Have you met my brother, Dr. Niles Crane?

speaker: Niles
text: [_still with face on:_] Enchanted.

speaker: Adair
text: Hi. [_notices face:_] Are you feeling okay?

speaker: Niles
text: [_deflated_] Bad shrimp. [_Frasier hits him_]

speaker: Adair
text: Oh. [_to Frasier:_] I so enjoyed our chat about Brecht, I'm just sorry we didn't get to finish it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, me too.

speaker: Adair
text: Um... [_laughs self-consciously:_] I never do this - but if you'd like to give me a call sometime, I'd like that. [_gives him her card_]  You don't have to call me, only if you want to, and we can talk about other, non-Brecht things... you see why I never do this?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm certainly glad that you did it with me. [_laughs_]

speaker: Adair
text: Nice meeting you, Miles.

speaker: Niles
text: [_angry:_] Okay.

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, who's that gentleman over there?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_notices:_] Oh, that's Matthew Apinnion - he's one of the theatre's biggest benefactors.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I just caught him back in my bedroom.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sure he just wandered in there by mistake.

speaker: Daphne
text: He was trying on my shoes!

speaker: Frasier
text: Interesting piece of information.  Something tells me that the theatre's going to get that new sound system.

speaker: Kimberly
text: On behalf of Seattle's Theatre Ensemble, I would like to thank Dr. Frasier Crane, for hosting tonight's benefit. But before we say goodnight, let's try and coax him into saying a few words.

speaker: Frasier
text: Alright.  Er... Alexander Pope once wrote that the theatre "aspires to wake the soul by tender strokes of art, to raise the genius and to mend the heart." I'd like to say that it's my privelege to help ensure the survival of this noble calling.  And, er, thank you all for coming and I'll see you on the opening night of "Run For Your Wife!" _Laughter and applause.  After the applause dies down a brunette woman -- Leslie Wellman - comes over to Frasier._

speaker: Leslie
text: Well, that was terrific.  Are you always this eloquent?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, hardly.  My Muse, alas, is somewhat ephemeral.

speaker: Leslie
text: Well, Dr. Crane, I'm glad to meet you.  Leslie Wellman, we met earlier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Leslie, of course.

speaker: Leslie
text: Well, I have to run but... I hope I'm not being too forward - I'd love it if you'd give me a call sometime.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd be delighted too.

speaker: Leslie
text: Here's my card.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you. [_pockets it_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, was that Natalie Spencer I saw you talking with?

speaker: Niles
text: [_excited:_] As a matter of fact it was.  I've been admiring her all evening, so I steeled myself and asked her if she would be free next week.

speaker: Frasier
text: And?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, her lips said "no" but her eyes said "read my lips." [_mad:_] I suppose you came over here to gloat because a woman came onto you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Not hardly, I wouldn't do that sort of thing.  I came over here to gloat because _two_ women came onto me!

speaker: Niles
text: Two?!

speaker: Frasier
text: My God, I've never had a night like this in my entire life! I'm a babe magnet, I'm catnip!

speaker: Niles
text: I think I feel a fur ball coming up.  Tell me your second conquest wasn't that haughty filly in the white dress - Kimberly Egan.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, your path is clear.

speaker: Niles
text: [_thinking:_] Oh... what's the point?  I can't take another rejection!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well Niles, I'll tell you what.  Seeing as how Cupid has so amply stocked my quiver this evening, I shall try and shine on your behalf.

speaker: Niles
text: [_nearly sick:_] Oh my God, you're unbearable!

speaker: Frasier
text: Kimberly, good evening.

speaker: Kimberly
text: Frasier.  Thank you again for tonight.  You really are a wonderful host.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  Listen, I don't usually do this sort of thing but there's a gentlemen here tonight who's rather taken with you.  He's an eligible doctor, he's just a bit shy about coming over and expressing those interests to you.

speaker: Kimberly
text: [_taken aback:_] Oh, that is so sweet! [_knowingly:_] Well, you tell your bashful friend, he needn't be so coy.  I'd love to go out with you some time, Frasier. [_hands him her card_] Call me tomorrow.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_Niles comes over_] Oh, do you know my brother?

speaker: Kimberly
text: Oh, of course I do. [_shakes Niles's hand_] Nice seeing you again, Miles! [_Niles grits his teeth_] _END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO_ _Scene One - KACL booth. It's Friday and Frasier is doing his show on KACL._

speaker: Doug
text: [_v.o.:_] Anyway, Dr. Crane, I've spent months now sending out resumes, pounding the pavement, but nothing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well Doug, it's possible you're simply going through a dry spell.  Good Lord, it happens to all of us.  Months go by with nothing, then completely out of the blue you get not one but three offers, without doing anything.  Not just for any jobs either, but for desirable ones, with ample salaries and fabulous perks.  Be patient.  Finding employment is much like dating - opportunities come along when you least expect them.

speaker: Doug
text: Thanks, Dr. Crane.  Actually, dating is the one area I don't have any problems in.  Right now, I've got two women interested in me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Two?  Well, that must make you the envy of MOST men! [_laughs_] Well, that's all for today, Seattle.  This is Dr. Frasier Crane, KACL 780. [_signs off_]

speaker: Roz
text: Alright, you've compared dating to unemployment, claustrophobia and bedwetting.  Is there anything you'd like to tell me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Ask me if I'm free this weekend.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, obviously...

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, ask me, come on.  And let me remind you, it's a three- day weekend.

speaker: Roz
text: [_put on:_] Are you free this weekend?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I have a date this evening.  And I've got a date tomorrow night.  Oh, and let me check my calendar for Sunday. [_checks it:_] Oh yes, another date! [_laughs_]

speaker: Roz
text: Good, not bad!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_excited:_] Not bad?!  If I didn't know better, I'd say someone was a little jealous.  After this weekend you may have to give up your dating crown!

speaker: Roz
text: I once had three dates on a single Saturday and still had time to defrost my refrigerator and rotate my tires.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_lost some happiness:_] It's a wonder you could rotate anything after that!  Alright, I concede.

speaker: Roz
text: Alright, good.  Will you help me with something?

speaker: Frasier
text: Sure.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, do you think it's weird to send a wedding present to someone you haven't seen or spoken to in eighteen years?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's a bit unusual but it's sweet nonetheless.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, what about if the wedding gift happens to be a sterling silver picture frame, [_holding it up_] and inside that happens to be a glamour photo of me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, does this have something to do with an old high-school chum you ran into yesterday during your holiday from hygiene?

speaker: Roz
text: I know, it all sounds so silly to you, but you don't understand.  Frasier, I group up in a tiny town and I still care about what those people think of me and John Coughlin will go back there and totally trash me!

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on, you're a beautiful, intelligent woman.  Do you really care what impressions people in your past have about you?

speaker: Roz
text: I guess not.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_into phone:_] Hello?  Why-y-y, Norm Peterson, you old horse thief! [_laughs_] Thanks for calling back so soon.  Well... just guess who's got three dates this weekend!   **A FLY IN THE OINTMENT**  _Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. That evening, Frasier is preparing for his date.  Frasier enters the main room with a bottle of wine and two glasses.  He tastes his food and makes a smile of delight before placing the wine and filling the glass.  Daphne is on the phone and begins speaking into it in a strange American accent.  It sounds manly._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_into phone:_] Hi, is this Johnny's Steakhouse?  Yeah, I'd like a table for two at eight � clock.  Sure, no problem, I'll hold.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_confused:_] What the hell are you doing?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_still in accent:_] Making dinner reservations.

speaker: Frasier
text: Not that, the voice.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_still:_] I'm trying my American.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're certainly trying this American!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_still, into phone:_] Anything on the patio?  Alright, cool. I'll see you then.  _Daphne hangs up as Frasier pours a second glass.  She reverts to her Manchester accent._

speaker: Daphne
text: You see, I'm just sick of people making such a fuss about my accent.  I like to be able to blend in on occasion, so I'm learning to speak American.

speaker: Frasier
text: And who is your tutor, a drag queen?

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, it's not very kind of you to mock me.  Especially after I've agreed to clear out for your big date.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, alright, thank you, Daphne - very much.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_American:_] I'll see you later. [_Manchester:_] You see, that's the problem when I speak American, I don't know what to do with my "R"'s!

speaker: Frasier
text: Try hauling it out of here! _Daphne understands this and exits.  Frasier meanwhile is getting excited.  He switches on some classical music to which he dances around a bit at before dimming the lights.  The doorbell rings and he makes a gesture that it's perfect timing.  He goes to the door and waits a second before opening it to Kimberly._

speaker: Frasier
text: Kimberly, hello.

speaker: Kimberly
text: Hello. [_enters:_] Frasier, it's so nice to see you again.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well let me take your things. [_takes them to coat rack_]

speaker: Kimberly
text: Thank you again for hosting the benefit.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well thank you again for chairing.  Listen, did we make as much money as we hoped to?

speaker: Kimberly
text: Well, we haven't tallied all of it but I'm guessing the evening will exceed our wildest expectations.

speaker: Frasier
text: My favorite sort of evening. [_laughs_]

speaker: Kimberly
text: Oh, I can admire this view for hours.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_staring at her:_] As could I. [_hands her a glass:_] Here we are - some wine, perhaps?

speaker: Kimberly
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: To... Possibilities. [_they clink glasses_]

speaker: Kimberly
text: So, tell me: how did you become interested in the theatre?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually I first caught the acting bug back at prep school.  The very first production I ever did was "A Mid- Summer Night's Dream."  Not to toot my own horn but my Bottom recieved a standing ovation.

speaker: Kimberly
text: [_taking the ulterior meaning:_] I'm not surprised.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs as they sit:_] And you?  How did you get involved?

speaker: Kimberly
text: Well, I worked in a lot of charities.  I actually founded one that promotes pet adoption.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Kimberly
text: I'm quite the dog lover.  You?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_lying:_] Heavens, yes.  You know, I have dream of some day owning a big house in the country where I can have as many dogs as I like.

speaker: Kimberly
text: I just love a man who loves animals.  Is it too much to ask that you are also a vegetarian?

speaker: Frasier
text: I just recently became one! _As they look at one another the front door opens, revealing Sherry and Martin loudly laughing their heads off._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras'.  The pharamcy left your ointment with the doorman.

speaker: Sherry
text: Somebody has a date! [_covering:_] Don't worry honey, it's just for prickly heat.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, thank you, Sherry.  Kimberly Egan, this is my father Martin Crane, and this is his companion Sherry Dempsey.

speaker: Sherry
text: Can I tempt you to some Peppermint Schnaps?  It really settles the tummy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, as much as I could use that right now, I think I'll pass.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh hey, sweetie, tell them that joke you told down at the bar.  When she told it I did an honest-to-God spit take. I'm not kidding you.  So much beer gushed out of there I was like Mt. St. Pauliga.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually I don't think...

speaker: Sherry
text: Okay, this really horny 80 year-old man goes into a confession box...

speaker: Martin
text: [_to Kimberly:_] You're not Catholic, are you?

speaker: Kimberly
text: Yes, I am.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, then you're really going to love it! [_laughs_]

speaker: Sherry
text: So anyway this horny old guy...

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Sherry, I think we've both heard this joke.

speaker: Sherry
text: Ohhh, Marty, I think we're cramping somebody's style. [_remembers:_] Oh hey, before I forget, this is for you. [_hands Frasier a small box_] I couldn't finish my veal chops. [_to Kimberly_] If you want to know the way to this man's heart, that is his favourite dish.

speaker: Kimberly
text: [_angry:_] Veal?!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_covering:_] Free range!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, hey listen, we're just going to take the dog for a walk.  Eddie? [_shouting:_] Eddie??

speaker: Martin
text: [_angry:_] Oh, you locked him in the back room again, didn't you?

speaker: Kimberly
text: [_outraged:_] What?!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, listen to him!  He's crying, that poor little thing.

speaker: Kimberly
text: Well, I guess you'll need a lot of extra room in that dream house to lock up all those dogs.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good, we can joke about this.  Kimberly, please, can I at least call you in a few days?  _She answers this question by simply slamming the door as she exits. Then Eddie comes running out and jumps on the dining room chair. He stares at the food that Frasier prepared._

speaker: Frasier
text: Go ahead!  _Eddie jumps up and begins eating with content.  FADE OUT  Scene Three - Frasier's kitchen. The next morning, Martin is standing at the stove, looking somewhat guilty.  Sherry comes in and hugs him from behind._

speaker: Sherry
text: Good morning, handsome.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, hi.  I was wondering when you were getting up.  Hungry?

speaker: Sherry
text: Well, a litte bit. [_opens fridge:_] How about some Chinese?

speaker: Martin
text: Chinese for breakfast?  Who eats that?

speaker: Sherry
text: About a billion Chinese people. [_they laugh, Martin less so_]

speaker: Martin
text: Alright, I'll get the plates and forks.

speaker: Sherry
text: Look, why don't we do it authentic this time.  Get the chopsticks!

speaker: Martin
text: No, I don't want to.

speaker: Sherry
text: Come on.

speaker: Martin
text: [_irritated:_] I don't feel like it.

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, just try it one time - it's not hard.

speaker: Martin
text: [_getting mad:_] It's not a question of hard - I just don't like using them, they don't work.

speaker: Sherry
text: Well, they've been around a lot longer than forks.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, our hands have been around a lot longer than that, why don't we just eat everything with our fingers?!

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, somebody's in a mood!

speaker: Martin
text: I'm not in a mood.

speaker: Sherry
text: You are.

speaker: Martin
text: Look, I just don't like you telling me to do things that I really don't want to do! [_tries to smile_]

speaker: Sherry
text: Fine, I will never mention the word "chopsticks" again. [_to herself:_] So touchy! _She walks up to the piano and whilst Martin is reading his paper begins to play.  Of course the melody is "Chopsticks."  Martin, in a huff, gets up and exits to the kitchen._

speaker: Martin
text: Thanks for taking what I said so seriously!

speaker: Sherry
text: Marty! [_enters kitchen with him_]  _Meanwhile, Daphne and Frasier are coming up to the apartment on the elevator.  They are talking about last night._

speaker: Frasier
text: So, Sherry's not there for longer than thirty seconds and she chases Kimberly right out of the apartment.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_American accent:_] Gee, I'm sorry, Dr. Crane.  That woman sure can be difficult.

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, this accent thing's getting downright annoying! Well anyway, I've been trying to call Kimberly all day to apologize...

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you doing?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_Manchester:_] Saying hello to Mr. Hicks in security.

speaker: Frasier
text: There's a hidden camera up there?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, but he said don't worry about it.  He said lots of people pull down their pants to tuck in their shirts.  Though he did recommend having that rash looked at.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_angry:_] Oh!  _The elevator gets to the right level.  The doors open and they step out.  Frasier notices Sherry's umbrella next to the front door._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh fine, Sherry's still here!  You know, she stays later each morning and more nights each week!  It's not what I had in mind when I moved in here.  It's bad enough I have to deal with Eddie and Dad and... [_realizes who he's talking to:_] their shenanigans!  _They enter the apartment.  The two stop as they hear Sherry and Martin still arguing in the kitchen._

speaker: Sherry
text: I can't believe you're getting upset over nothing.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I don't consider it nothing.

speaker: Sherry
text: I think we should talk about this.

speaker: Martin
text: I dont want to talk about it.

speaker: Sherry
text: To not talk about it is just plain stupid!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, so I'm stupid now, am I?

speaker: Frasier
text: They're arguing. [_hopeful:_] Could there be trouble in paradise?

speaker: Daphne
text: This is awkward.  Should we let them know we are here?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, they might stop!

speaker: Martin
text: When did you get back?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just now.

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, well don't worry, we were just talking.

speaker: Martin
text: We're finished talking. [_exits to bedroom_]

speaker: Sherry
text: Maybe you have.  Marty, I think we should talk about it. [_exits with him_]

speaker: Martin
text: [_o.s.:_] Well, I don't want to.

speaker: Frasier
text: I've never heard them talking like that before.  Dare I get my hopes up?

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't count on it.  Once an argument moves into the bedroom, a woman can always get the man to make up.

speaker: Frasier
text: I wouldn't be so sure about that.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh come on now: men and women have been having this conversation for centuries.  The woman always says, "do we always have to fight?"

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, the man would say, "well it's your own fault, you started it!

speaker: Daphne
text: Can't we at least talk this out? [_sits on the couch_] Come on, sit with me on the bed.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't feel like sitting!

speaker: Daphne
text: Do you have to be so cold?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you made me angry!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_crying:_] You could at least put your arms around me!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Daphne, I'm sorry...

speaker: Frasier
text: You're right.  We're made up already.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, at least they'll be in a good mood when they come out. There's nothing like make-up sex.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, please, Sherry and dad don't have make-up sex.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well of course, they're probably at it...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_stops her:_] My dad and Sherry do not have sex!

speaker: Sherry
text: So long kids, it was nice knowing you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Did that actually just happen?

speaker: Daphne
text: I guess I called that one wrong.

speaker: Daphne
text: Is everything alright?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh yeah, fine, it was a long time coming.

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you okay with this?

speaker: Martin
text: Well yes, I mean I'm not jumping up and down but I think it's better for both of us - yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, yeah, Sherry and I had a lot of laughs but you know there's a lot of things about her that bugged me, and Lord knows I'm sure she was bugged by a lot of things that I did. So, well, no really, this is fine.  Fine. [_exits to kitchen_]

speaker: Daphne
text: He seems to be taking it very well!

speaker: Frasier
text: Perhaps I should go see if he feels like talking about it.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_into phone:_] Hello?  Oh yes, hi, Niles.  Well, actually it isn't a very good time.  No, well dad and Sherry just broke up.  He seems to be taking it okay, I guess.  Oh no, I don't think it's appropriate.  Well, it's just too soon for us to be celebrating right now.  _Daphne shakes her head as Frasier replaces the receiver. The phone rings again._
